Tom na Gruagaich (Beinn Alligin)

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Tom na Gruagaich, formerly a Top, was promoted to become the second Munro of Beinn Alligin in 1997. It has sensational views over the sea to Skye and for most walkers is the start of the sensational traverse of the mountain.

 You have not climbed Tom na Gruagaich (Beinn Alligin).

Region: Torridon

Altitude: 922 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 4.40/5
Rating: 4.4/5 (107 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Beinn Alligin ridge traverse

Other routes and challenges

If you wish to avoid the scramble over the Horns of Alligin, it is best to retrace your steps on the above route back over Tom na Gruagaich after climbing Sgurr Mor.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Torridon B&B
